intro: Habracanthus atropurpureus, commonly known as the purplestem false nettle, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, purple-tinged stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to reddish in color. Its fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. It thrives in moist, disturbed habitats such as wetlands and roadside ditches.
